001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.cli;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.base.BitcoinNetwork;
004import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
005import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient;
006import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.RpcConfig;
007import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.bitcoind.BitcoinConfFile;
008import org.apache.commons.cli.Options;
009import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcException;
010import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.cli.BaseJsonRpcTool;
011
012import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory;
013import java.io.PrintWriter;
014import java.net.URI;
015import java.net.URISyntaxException;
016
017import static org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.RpcURI.RPCPORT_REGTEST;
018import static org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.RpcURI.RPCPORT_TESTNET;
019
020/**
021 * An attempt at cloning the bitcoin-cli tool, but using Java and bitcoinj
022 */
023public class BitcoinCLITool extends BaseJsonRpcTool {
024    public final static String commandName = "cj-bitcoin-cli";
025    private final Options options;
026
027    public BitcoinCLITool() {
028        this.options = new BitcoinRpcCliOptions();
029    }
030
031    @Override
032    public String name() {
033        return commandName;
034    }
035
036    @Override
037    public Options options() {
038        return options;
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * main method for bitcoinj-cli tool.
043     *
044     * See {@link BitcoinRpcCliOptions} for options and https://bitcoin.org/en/developer-reference#bitcoin-core-apis[Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC API]
045     * for the methods and parameters. Users can use `-?` to get general help or {@code help _command_} to get help
046     * on a specific command.
047     *
048     * @param args options, JSON-RPC method, JSON-RPC parameters
049     */
050    public static void main(String[] args) {
051        BitcoinCLITool command = new BitcoinCLITool();
052        int status = command.run(System.out, System.err, args);
053        System.exit(status);
054    }
055
056    @Override
057    public BitcoinCLICall createCall(PrintWriter out, PrintWriter err, String... args) {
058        return new BitcoinCLICall(this, out, err, args);
059    }
060
061    public static class BitcoinCLICall extends BaseJsonRpcTool.CommonsCLICall {
062        private BitcoinClient client;
063        private final boolean rpcWait;
064
065        public BitcoinCLICall(BitcoinCLITool tool, PrintWriter out, PrintWriter err, String[] args) {
066            super(tool, out, err, args);
067            rpcWait = line.hasOption("rpcwait");
068        }
069
070        @Override
071        public BitcoinClient rpcClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory) {
072            // Not threadsafe
073            // This needs work if there are ever going to be multiple clients calling this method
074            if (client == null) {
075                RpcConfig config = getRPCConfig();
076                client = createClient(sslSocketFactory, config);
077                if (rpcWait) {
078                    // TODO: Add logging here to replace the System.out.println
079                    //System.out.println("Connecting to: " + getRPCConfig().getURI() + " with -rpcWait");
080                    boolean available = false;   // Wait up to 1 hour
081                    try {
082                        available = client.waitForServer(60*60);
083                    } catch (JsonRpcException e) {
084                        rpcTool.printError(this, "JSON-RPC Exception: " + e.getMessage());
085                        throw new ToolException(1, e.getMessage());
086                    }
087                    if (!available) {
088                        rpcTool.printError(this,"Timeout error.");
089                        throw new ToolException(1, "Timeout error.");
090                    }
091                }
092            }
093            return client;
094        }
095
096        @Override
097        public BitcoinClient rpcClient() {
098            return rpcClient((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault());
099        }
100
101        /**
102         * Override this method to customize the client implementation subclass
103         * @param config Configuration information for connecting to server
104         * @return a newly constructed BitcoinClient with specified config
105         */
106        protected BitcoinClient createClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, RpcConfig config) {
107            return new BitcoinClient( sslSocketFactory, config.network(),
108                    config.getURI(),
109                    config.getUsername(),
110                    config.getPassword());
111        }
112
113        public RpcConfig getRPCConfig() {
114            RpcConfig confFileConfig = BitcoinConfFile.readDefaultConfig().getRPCConfig();
115            URI uri = getServerURI(confFileConfig.getURI());
116            String user = line.getOptionValue("rpcuser", confFileConfig.getUsername());
117            String pass = line.getOptionValue("rpcpassword", confFileConfig.getPassword());
118            Network network;
119            if (line.hasOption("regtest")) {
120                network = BitcoinNetwork.REGTEST;
121            } else if (line.hasOption(("testnet"))) {
122                network = BitcoinNetwork.TESTNET;
123            } else {
124                // TODO: Use network params from BitcoinConfFile, before falling back
125                network =BitcoinNetwork.MAINNET;
126            }
127            return new RpcConfig(network, uri, user, pass);
128        }
129
130        private URI getServerURI(URI confFileURI) {
131            String scheme = confFileURI.getScheme();
132            String host = confFileURI.getHost();
133            int port = confFileURI.getPort();
134            String file = confFileURI.getPath();
135
136            if (line.hasOption("rpcssl")) {
137                scheme = "https";
138            }
139            if (line.hasOption("rpcconnect")) {
140                host = line.getOptionValue("rpcconnect", host);
141            }
142            if (line.hasOption("regtest"))  {
143                port = RPCPORT_REGTEST;
144            } else if (line.hasOption("testnet")) {
145                port = RPCPORT_TESTNET;
146            }
147            if (line.hasOption("rpcport")) {
148                String portString = line.getOptionValue("rpcport");
149                port = Integer.parseInt(portString);
150            }
151            URI rpcServerURI = null;
152            try {
153                rpcServerURI = new URI(scheme, null, host, port, file, null, null);
154            } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
155                // We should be careful that this never happens
156                e.printStackTrace();
157                // But if it does, throw an unchecked exception
158                throw new RuntimeException(e);
159            }
160            return rpcServerURI;
161        }
162
163
164    }
165}
